intro: Epilobium stracheyanum, commonly known as the red campion, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm. The plant features showy pink or red flowers that bloom in summer, arranged in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in a variety of habitats, including meadows, roadsides, and woodland edges.
